qas.question: When did the Southern and Northern Nigeria Protectorates merge?
Which empire ruled Nigeria as a colony?
When did Nigeria become independent from Britain?
When did a Nigerian Civil War begin?
When did Nigeria have a fair presidential election?

context: Modern-day Nigeria has been the site of numerous kingdoms and tribal states over the millennia. The modern state originated from <a1_0>British<a1_0/> colonial rule beginning in the 19th century, and the merging of the Southern Nigeria Protectorate and Northern Nigeria Protectorate in <a0_0>1914<a0_0/>. The British set up administrative and legal structures whilst practising indirect rule through traditional chiefdoms. Nigeria became a formally independent federation in <a2_0>1960<a2_0/>, and plunged into a civil war from <a3_0>1967<a3_0/> to 1970. It has since alternated between democratically-elected civilian governments and military dictatorships, until it achieved a stable democracy in 1999, with its <a4_0>2011<a4_0/> presidential elections being viewed as the first to be conducted reasonably freely and fairly.
